DOC.brief_summary: Adolescence emerge adulthood critical period health outcome may imperil youth Type 1 Diabetes ( T1D ) . Due strong presence alcohol use college environment , college student T1D may especially vulnerable risk . Our goal develop preliminary evidence support scalable intervention target diabetes health management alcohol use avoidance college youth T1D . For project investigator engage least 120 youth T1D college . The study sample draw two national , non-profit , peer support base group : College Diabetes Network ( CDN ) TuDiabetes Network . The study aim 1 ) develop pilot educational video intervention ; 2 ) determine acceptability efficiency various web platform engage college student complete survey health alcohol use ; 3 ) compare effectiveness delivery brief intervention deliver peer versus provider . The investigator plan engage 120 college youth T1D complete survey health knowledge alcohol use behavior . Baseline survey item ask participant knowledge , attitude , practices/plans diabetes self-management alcohol use college . In response survey item , participant provide information topic include general disease-specific health information , well attitude , behavior , belief , knowledge relate alcohol use . Participants also respond question relate social support , mental health , perseverance commitment long term goal . Following baseline survey , participant present brief educational video diabetes self-management alcohol use risk . Participants randomize receive one two educational video intervention . One version frame deliver peer-based source provider , content otherwise identical . Participants receive 2 follow-up survey ; one immediately follow view video second two week later . Both immediate follow-up 2-week follow-up survey test salience , recall , effect health knowledge , beliefs behavioral intention . While main purpose pilot ascertain preference absence preliminary data , priori hypothesis peer delivery great impact population .
